back.definition: Average time from vulnerability disclosure to patch deployment. Goal: <30 days standard, <7 days critical, <24 hours emergency (CVSS 10.0).
back.example: Equifax MTTP: 60+ days for CVSS 10.0. Industry standard: <7 days. Order of magnitude failure. Track by severity: Critical, High, Medium, Low.

back.definition: Aggregate metric. Factors: Vuln count weighted by severity, patch compliance, security control coverage, incident count. Trend over time.
back.example: Score 0-100. Target: >80. Components: Critical vulns (-10 each), patch SLA compliance (+20), security tool coverage (+20). Executive dashboard.

back.definition: % of security controls functioning as intended. Annual assessment. Identify control gaps. Drives remediation priorities.
back.example: NIST 800-53: 300 controls for High systems. Assessment: 285 effective (95%), 10 partially (3%), 5 ineffective (2%). Fix the 15 gaps.

back.definition: % compliant with policies/regulations. Examples: Patch policy compliance, training completion, access review completion. Audit readiness.
back.example: Patch policy: 95% systems patched within 30 days. Training: 100% annual security awareness. Equifax: Low compliance = breach.

unlock_content.title: Metrics Strategy
points: Align with business goals: Reduce risk, ensure compliance, enable business
SMART metrics: Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound
Leading indicators: Predictive (vuln count). Lagging: Historical (breach count).
Balance: Don't just measure easy things. Measure important things.
Equifax need: MTTP, vulnerability debt, monitoring uptime
unlock_content.bonus_fact: Bad metric: Total firewall rules. Good metric: % critical assets protected by firewall.

unlock_content.title: Data Collection
points: Automate: Manual collection = stale data. APIs from tools.
Sources: SIEM, vulnerability scanner, ticketing system, asset inventory
Frequency: Real-time dashboards, weekly reports, monthly trends
Data quality: Garbage in, garbage out. Validate accuracy.
Equifax: Had scanner data pero not aggregated/analyzed
unlock_content.bonus_fact: SOAR can aggregate metrics from disparate tools into single dashboard.

unlock_content.title: Analysis & Reporting
points: Executive dashboard: High-level trends, red/yellow/green status
Technical reports: Detailed findings for security team
Trend analysis: Month-over-month, year-over-year
Benchmarking: Compare to industry peers, best practices
Actionable: Every metric should drive decision
Equifax: Metrics existed pero no accountability for poor performance
unlock_content.bonus_fact: Good metrics answer: Are we getting better or worse? Where to invest?

unlock_content.title: Metrics Maturity
points: Review quarterly: Are metrics still relevant?
Add new metrics as program matures
Retire metrics that don't drive action
Adjust targets: Initial target 70%, mature target 95%
Culture: Data-driven security decisions
Equifax lesson: Metrics without consequences = useless
unlock_content.bonus_fact: Mature orgs: Security metrics integrated into executive scorecards. C-suite accountability.

options.feedback: Incorrecto. Compliance es benefit pero not primary purpose.

options.text: Drive accountability, measure improvement, justify budget, identify gaps
options.feedback: CORRECTO! Metrics purposes: 1) Accountability: MTTP metric = patch team responsible. 2) Improvement: Trending shows if getting better/worse. 3) Budget justification: 'Need $X to reduce MTTP from 30→7 days'. 4) Gap identification: Control effectiveness 60% = need investment. 5) Executive communication: Translate security to business language. Equifax: Had metrics pero no accountability. MTTP 60+ days pero no consequences. Metrics without action = theater.

options.text: Para hacer security team look busy
options.feedback: Incorrecto. Vanity metrics (ex: total scans run) don't matter. Outcome metrics (ex: vulns remediated) matter.
